grogupy
  • Contributing to grogupy

Contributing to grogupy

Currently there is no way to contribute to the development. However here is a summary for the ‘approved’ developers.

Create environment

First you have to clone the repository from Github.

git clone https://github.com/danielpozsar/grogu.git

Then the easiest way is to create a a virtual environment (.venv), for example with VSCode.

  • Use at least python 3.9

  • install dependencies from:

    • requirements.txt

    • requirements-dev.txt

    • /docs/requirements.txt

Finally you have to install and run pre-commit, which is mainly used to automatically format the code, which makes it nicer and reduces git differences.

pre-commit install
pre-commit run --all-files

Build and upload wheel

You can find a detailed documentation on PYPI, but you can read here a short summary. First you need some API Tokens for PyPi, to be able to upload. You can read about this here. I own the current project, so you have to contact me.

Use the following commands for a quick setup from the grogupy_project folder:

  • Build wheel.

python -m build

  • Install wheel.

pip install dist/grogupy<version>

  • Run tests.

pytest

If you want to upload to the PYPI repository, then don’t forget to rewrite the version numbers.

python -m twine upload dist/*

Build documentation

Yo can go to the docs/source directory and modify the .rst files to change the documentation. However to document the API of the package it is advised to use automatic documentation generation.

  • To build the documentation navigate to the docs/source folder.

cd docs/source

  • Then build the documentation. After this the html page can be found in docs/source/_build/html. If there is already a documentation you can remove it by running make clean.

make html
